pullRequest.title: GH-2390 shacl rsx spec
pullRequest.bodyText:
GitHub issue resolved: #2390 
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

Respec html document
turtle namespace file


PR Author Checklist (see the contributor guidelines for more details):

 my pull request is self-contained
 I've added tests for the changes I made
 I've applied code formatting (you can use mvn process-resources to format from the command line)
 every commit message starts with the issue number (GH-xxxx) followed by a meaningful description of the change
 every commit has been signed off

Note: we merge all feature pull requests using squash and merge. See RDF4J git merge strategy for more details.

commit.message:
GH-2390 initial commit

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2390 added general documention for the RSX draft and split up the examples.

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: I haven't tested if this work, or if it just ends up being downloaded.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@ + + + + + Eclipse RDF4J SHACL Extensions + + +
    +
  • +Specification +
    • +
  • +Namespace (turtle) +
    • +
+

nodes.bodyText: Do we need a CQ for this?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,263 @@
+<!DOCTYPE html>
+<html>
+<head>
+    <meta charset="utf-8">
+    <title>Eclipse RDF4J SHACL Extensions</title>
+    <script src="https://www.w3.org/Tools/respec/respec-w3c" class="remove" defer></script>

nodes.bodyText: We should add more editors. Probably Vladimir if he wants to be listed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,263 @@
+<!DOCTYPE html>
+<html>
+<head>
+    <meta charset="utf-8">
+    <title>Eclipse RDF4J SHACL Extensions</title>
+    <script src="https://www.w3.org/Tools/respec/respec-w3c" class="remove" defer></script>
+    <script class="remove">
+        var respecConfig = {
+            specStatus: "unofficial",
+            editors: [
+                { name: "Håvard Ottestad" },
+            ],

nodes.bodyText: Good point - I think we do. Actually worth verifying that it's acceptable before investing heavily. I doubt it's a problem, but W3C sometimes use a non-standard license for their software (although looking at the respec license at https://github.com/w3c/respec/blob/develop/LICENSE, it might be a BSD license). Best be sure that the legal team are ok with it.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,263 @@
+<!DOCTYPE html>
+<html>
+<head>
+    <meta charset="utf-8">
+    <title>Eclipse RDF4J SHACL Extensions</title>
+    <script src="https://www.w3.org/Tools/respec/respec-w3c" class="remove" defer></script>

nodes.bodyText:
I don't understand the setup. Why have an html file that links to another html file and a turtle file? Why not simply have a link to the turtle file inside the specification? For that matter, why have a turtle file at all?
Given that we have multiple files relating to the same thing, I'd prefer if we could organize this a little neater: a subdirectory, for one thing.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@ + + + + + Eclipse RDF4J SHACL Extensions + + +
    +
  • +Specification +
    • +
  • +Namespace (turtle) +
    • +
+

nodes.bodyText: Not sure if this is the place to do it, but I notice that the current rendered spec links to https://eclipse.github.io/rdf4j/ at the top (under "latest editor's draft"). Can we adjust that to link to the correct page?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,263 @@
+<!DOCTYPE html>
+<html>
+<head>
+    <meta charset="utf-8">
+    <title>Eclipse RDF4J SHACL Extensions</title>
+    <script src="https://www.w3.org/Tools/respec/respec-w3c" class="remove" defer></script>
+    <script class="remove">
+        var respecConfig = {
+            specStatus: "unofficial",
+            editors: [
+                { name: "Håvard Ottestad" },
+            ],

commit.message:
GH-2390 moved link page to content, changed to markdown

- moved static files into subdir for organization
- fixed link in respec
